li.p: Create a secret user token
Make the kanban:
Add a project to your IG, with a Kanban board.
Add your (technical) user as an admin (project admin, not repo admin)
Copy the Kanban board's url, e.g. https://github.com/openhie/hiv-ig/projects/1
Setup 4 columns: Inbox, To Do, In Progress, Done
Setup automation: Every new issue goes into Inbox; All Closed issues go into Done

Test the automation by creating a new issue AND associating it with the project . It should show up in the Kanban, in the Inbox column. Then close the issue (from the kanban, open it and click (close issue). It should go to the Done column
Check the column ID by opening the kanban source in the browser and searcing for Inbox:
Make the form:
Login to the google account you want to use (e.g. A technical user)
Clone this one: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1G490wtD_sXWkHmqiqZgriC_DR5-GLwvkMIqUljK_fOA/edit
Add header - 1600 x 400 px
Create Prefilled Link and mark the fields so that you can change them:
Open the form's Script Editor. Update the following fields:
Change the handle and repo to that of the IG
Change the project to the project ID (seen in the URL in 2.c above, typically 1)
Change the columnID to what is obtained in step 2.f above
Change ghToken and ghToken2 to secret tokens by your user
Add Triggers
Edit ...Current Project's triggers
Create a new trigger - OnFormSubmit; head; From form; On form submit; choose your notification settings (best immediately in the beginning to debug if needed)
Google will ask you to sign in and ask it to use the Gmail account. Do so if you trust this code :)
Optionally, run once in the console. Comment and uncomment the lines indicated. If all is well, there is now a new item in your inbox,
Create / update a yaml file in your IG named data\input\features.yml, with the content

div.pre: --- feedback: active: true formUrl: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdFe3PHRfKlbIf1p1WJ3oqTjnMA_BNyaTdmiKTjpu9RYIaBdQ/viewform?usp=pp_url dashboard: https://github.com/openhie/hiv-ig/projects/1 parameters: - name: "'entry.1353807103'" value: encodeURIComponent($(document).attr('title')) - name: "'entry.247644557'" value: document.getElementById(id).textContent
div.p: (make sure you have the --- in the first line, otherwise it will fail)
